subsection.name: Introduction
subsection.p: This plugin displays all JSON or YAML swagger files present on a website and display them on a single page using the Swagger UI

subsection.name: Configuration
subsection.p: Simply put the files by following this tree : webapp/plugins/{name-of-the-plugin}/api/swagger/v{version-number}/{name-of-the-file}[.json/.yaml]
Using Pluginwizard, it creates and put the file swagger.json in the right place
For API deployed on several servers, it's possible to use variables into JSON or YAML files host, port et context as follow :

subsection.name: Usage
subsection.p: You just have to access the xpage swaggerui : /jsp/site/Portal.jsp?page=swaggerui
Note that the plugin swaggerui only displays the json files of enabled plugins
